1.title: Forging Jaime Lannister's Sword: Game of Thrones
1.plot: In this Premiere Episode, Tony builds Jaime Lannister's sword from "Game of Thrones." This blade will be crafted from scratch, with a hilt forged from molten bronze, and then taken outside for an epic battle against a windshield.

2.title: Blacksmithing Oddjob's Hat: James Bond
2.plot: The prop used in Goldfinger by Oddjob was made by British hat makers, Lock and Co. The bowler hat was then adapted by inserting a chakram into the brim. Oscar winning special effects legend John Stears was responsible for making the hat fly.

3.title: Forging Finn's Golden Sword: Adventure Time
3.plot: The golden sword of battle (also known as Scarlet) is Finn's weapon of choice throughout most of seasons one and two. The blade is dented, chipped, and dirty. Its hilt is black with some worn leather grip-straps and a red gemstone in the pommel.

4.title: Building Raphael's Sais: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
4.plot: The sai is a defensive truncheon originating in Okinawa. It is often mistaken for a dagger, as its use in the TMNT media would reflect. In traditional sai combat, they are carried in pairs, called saitachi. One is used for blocks and trapping weapons, while the other is used for striking, mostly with the knuckle.

5.title: Plasma Cutting Batarangs: The Dark Knight
5.plot: A batarang is a roughly bat-shaped throwing weapon used by the DC Comics superhero Batman. The name is a portmanteau of bat and boomerang, and was originally spelled baterang. Although they are named after boomerangs, batarangs have become more like shuriken in recent interpretations.

6.title: Forging He-Man's Sword: Masters of the Universe
6.plot: The Power Sword is a fictional sword from the Masters of the Universe toyline, sometimes also referred to as the Sword of Power and the Sword of Grayskull. It started out as a mystical object in the early stories, in which Skeletor tries to obtain both halves and put them together in order to gain control over Castle Greyskull, while He-Man's role is to stop him by using more regular weapons such as an axe and a shield.

7.title: Building Sora's Keyblade: Kingdom Hearts
7.plot: Keyblades (Kiburedo) are mysterious weapons that are heavily featured in the Kingdom Hearts series. Wielded by the main character, Sora, as well as a number of other important characters, the Keyblade is a main part of the battle between Darkness and Light.

8.title: Forging the Diamond Sword: Minecraft
8.plot: Diamond Sword is a weapon added by vanilla Minecraft and is considered the highest tier of weapon added by the original game. Diamond Sword is primarily used for attacking but can be used for opening Coconuts.

9.title: Crafting Captain America's Shield
9.plot: The most well-known shield belongs to Captain America. It is virtually indestructible. It is as much an offensive weapon as a defensive one for Captain America. Cap uses it against his enemies, mainly, by throwing it at them and can perform mindbogglingly impossible tricks with it.

10.title: Forging Gimli's Bearded Axe: Lord of the Rings
10.plot: A bearded axe, or Skeggöx (from Old Norse Skegg, beard + öx, axe) refers to various axes, used as a tool and weapon, as early as the 6th century AD. It is most commonly associated with Viking Age Scandinavians.

12.title: Building Cloud's Buster Sword: Final Fantasy VII
12.plot: The Buster Sword is classified as an enormous broadsword. From tip to handle, it is approximately five to six feet long, with a single-edged large blade approximately one foot wide.

13.title: Sword of Omens: Thundercats
13.plot: The Basic sized Sword of Omens is 6 inches from tip to pommel and features a prominent Eye of Thundera, with the Eye form on one side and the Thundercats logo on the other.

14.title: Orcish Battle Axe: Skyrim
14.plot: The Orcish Battleaxe really sets the tone for the crude craftsmanship that is a corner stone of all Orc equipment. A one sided massive axe blade, made entirely of metal, sits atop of a long handle that is wrapped all the way up in a crosshatch manner with leather strips.

15.title: Wolverine Claws: X-Men
15.plot: Razor sharp edge of Wolverine's bone claws. Aside from being practically indestructible, the claws are capable of cutting any solid material, with the known exception of True Adamantium and Vibranium (Captain America's Shield).

16.title: Hit Girl's Detachable Sword: Kick-Ass
16.plot: Hit-Girl is the deuteragonist in the Kick-Ass comic book series. She is a young but effective vigilante, trained by her father from an early age to be a costumed superhero and assassin.

17.title: Link's Master Sword: Legend of Zelda
17.plot: The Master Sword, also known as The Blade of Evil's Bane, is a recurring legendary sword in the Zelda series. Originally crafted by the goddess Hylia as the Goddess Sword, it was later forged into the Master Sword by the goddess's chosen hero and its spirit Fi.

18.title: Ichigo's Zangetsu Sword (Bleach)
18.plot: Unlike most zanpakuto, Zangetsu has no release command. The shikai form of Zangetsu resembles an over sized, though more elegant, cleaver blade without a hilt guard.

31.title: Pokémon Honedge - MAN AT ARMS
31.plot: Honedge is a Pokémon that resembles a sword from the medieval times. Honedge's appearance sheathed is dark brown with curved lines across its surface. Its appearance unsheathed is a silver sword, with a gem that looks like an eye engraved on its hilt.

32.title: Black Star's Chain Scythe (Soul Eater)
32.plot: The Chain Scythe, also known as a Kusarigama in the English dub, is one of Tsubaki's Weapon forms. Tsubaki transforms into a long metal chain with each end of the chain tipped with a yellow handle that has a small double-edged and double-pointed scythe blade attached.

33.title: Blade's Daywalker Glaives
33.plot: The term "glaive" is frequently misapplied in modern fantasy fiction, films and video games to various thrown weapons, similar to the chakram or hunga munga, which can mystically return to the thrower (as in popular myths surrounding the boomerang). These objects are fictional, and are not in any way related to the historical glaive.

34.title: Jake's Sword (Adventure Time) Feat. Smosh
34.plot: The sword has an unusual appearance, the hilt being longer than the actual blade. It has a skull for a pommel and an eye on the guard. Half of the blade is serrated on one edge. Jake most likely is not proficient with this sword, as he is seldom shown using it.

35.title: Jon Snow's Longclaw
35.plot: Longclaw is a Valyrian steel sword, in the possession of House Mormont for five centuries. Longclaw is a bastard sword (also known as a "Hand-and-a-half sword"), which is longer than a longsword, but shorter than a greatsword.

37.title: William Wallace Claymore
37.plot: Master swordsmith Tony Swatton forges your favorite weapons from video games, movies, and television. This week, he recreates William Wallace's claymore from Braveheart.

38.title: Kirito's Elucidator
38.plot: Master swordsmith Tony Swatton forges your favorite weapons from video games, movies, and television. This week, he recreates Kirito's Elucidator sword from Sword Art Online. The Elucidator sword is a single-handed sword that served as Kirito's primary weapon in Sword Art Online.

39.title: The Lich King's Frostmourne: World of Warcraft
39.plot: Tony Swatton and his team finally tackle the Lich King's very own Frostmourne. The only problem is, will the survive the build?

locations: Sword and Stone, 723 North Victory Boulevard, Burbank, California, USA::(The Sword and the Stone)
imdb.title: Man at Arms
plot: Each week a team of blacksmiths and craftsman re-create items from popular culture, such as the sword used in a film or crossbow from a new computer game.
